data.title: Interesting museum
data.text: There is a small museum underneath this monument specific to the Civil War.  It only takes 30-60 minutes to make it through depending on your pace.  It is free and worth a stop.  We skipped the ride to the top of the monument due to a lengthy line.  You can purchase an elevator ticket or take the stairs for free, but you have to wait in the line either way.

data.title: Informative museum and fun climb to the top!
data.text:
This is a great place to visit if you want to know what Indiana's role in the Civil war was.
We enjoyed seeing the videos and reading the literature about the
Civil War.
We climbed the 330 steps to the top of the monument.(You can take an elevator if you choose).
What a beautiful view from the top!

data.title: A pleasant surprise...
data.text: Monument Circle is an Indy Icon. It was built to commemorate the American Civil War. So you come expecting to see the Outside, and enjoy the fountains and statuary. Please do yourself a favor and go inside and under the monument! the museum inside is very informative and helps you understand Indiana's contributions and role in the war. Considering the space they had to work with, the museum is well laid out. Enjoy!

data.title: Well done museum
data.text: Worth a quick stop. We have yet to be able to climb up the tower. First time it was closed. This past weekend, they were short staffed and a visitor had passed out at the top. Consequently the tower was closed. However, the museum in the basement is quite nice. Just the right balance of reading, looking, and watching to keep both children and adults occupied.

data.title: Beautiful towering view
data.text: Great sight for visitors and tourist, historical monument in the city centre, clean and magnificent view from all angles.

data.title: Hidden treasure inside
data.text: Make sure you go inside the the museum burried deep in this monument.  I is truly amazing and a hidden feature to those not from the area.  You are certain to look in amazement at the artifacts.

data.title: Free museum
data.text: We didn't even realize there was a museum underneath.  You can breeze through it in 20 minutes, but I recommend a solid hour to read the stories and see everything.  The monument is huge with lots of detailed depictions.  There are plenty of places to sit in the sunshine and enjoy the sounds of the water and birds.

data.title: Gorgeous
data.text: This is a must see attraction. This is a stunning piece of art in the city center. the entire area around is geared toward foot traffic so it makes for such a beautiful sense of community. To be able to see such a well maintained piece of history and to feel the pride involved is breath taking. Well done, Indy!

data.title: Historic Presence on the Circle!
data.text: It is important to never forget those that gave their lives for our Country.  The Museum can be found in the underground level of the Monument located on the Circle.  The artifacts speak to the role Indiana played during the Civil War - great history to share with all age groups.

data.title: Nice small museum
data.text: This is a small museum that is inside the Indiana War Memorial (center of Monument Circle). It takes no more than an hour to walk through, but was interesting and well done. No fee, but they do take donations.

data.title: Nice
data.text: Great little place to burn a couple of hours.  Fantastic informative museum downstairs.  The view from the top is really nice and a great place for pictures!

data.title: fun and great place to take pics
data.text: we ended up here on accident couldn't visit our original location so we settled and we were happy we did. The place is stunning great place for taking pics and family fun time. right across from the Colonel Eli Lilly Civil War Museum - Soldiers & Sailors Monument is a candy store and a place with great icecream. my handicap son was in awe.

data.title: Informative exhibit on the civil war
data.text: The exhibit described the people and units from Indiana that served in the civil war. It is not a large place, and it can be covered in 1 hour, or much longer if you read all the captions. A good description of the Indiana involvement, but does not attempt to deal with the whole war.

data.title: Very interesting local historical site
data.text: The Civil War museum is very well done and gives some of the local perspective along with the broader history.  The monument itself is gigantic and you can go to the top for the view.  Keep in mind, the view is still Indianapolis, not NYC or Paris!  I found the 300+ steps to be very tiring and wished I'd opted for the elevator.  Our teenage son thought it was cool and learned a bit of history.

data.title: Small, but Great Civil War Museum
data.text: While fairly small, this Civil War Museum is packed with information, exhibits, and amazing artifacts.  Located in Monument Circle, you also have the option to climb th ed 30-ish flights of steps to get some great views at the top.  Since admission is free, and it's located in the heart of the city, there's no reason to not check this out.  My favorite things in the museum were the various artifacts on display... the coolest is a tree trunk from the Battle of Gettysburg that has a cannon ball lodged in it.

data.title: Majestic, Releavent, in the center of the action.
data.text: In the very center of downtown Indianapolis stands a monument to the veterans of the American Civil War.  It also pays tribute to soldiers of the Revolutionary War, War of 1812 and Spanish American War.  Originally rising above the landscape, now surrounded by a city that grew up around her.  On the top of this obelisk shaped monument is Lady Victory, the base is surrounded by terraces and fountains.   The entire monument is only 15 feet shorter than The Statue of Liberty in New York.  Made of Indiana limestone, the scuptures are larger than life in structure and ideal.  Must see for every visitor and every citizen of Indiana.

data.title: Great Views
data.text: A wonderful memorial, beautiful and with amazing views from the top.  Entry is free - you can walk to the top for free or pay and take the elevator.  (free for Military)

data.title: No bad photo angles
data.text: We drove through Indianapolis quickly but wanted to stop here and am so glad we did. The circle was fun to walk around, with coffee shops, a pretty church, and other local sights near. We bought a few little things from the gift shop, which was nice. You buy tickets for the elevator there, which were $2 or you could walk for free. The staircase up is extremely narrow and somewhat steep, so I we took the elevator. It fits 4 adults comfortably but you could squeeze a few more or some kids. The view at the top is pretty cool, but crowded if there are several people up there. We got there right when they opened and there was no line but by the time we came down after only 15 minutes, there was probably almost 20 people in line so get there early and be prepared to wait. We had to skip the museum this time due to time but will be through on our way back.

data.title: Another incredible surprise.
data.text: One could easily miss this incredible museum. Free, and loaded with relics that will blow your mind! Dont miss it...

data.title: Beautiful!
data.text:
My son and I recently traveled to Indianapolis.  We traveled to the top of the Monument and the view is absolutely breath taking.  The view of the city below is
absolutely beautiful.  I would definitely do it again if ever returning to Indy.  I would
recommend that everyone visit the Monument because the view below is gorgeous!
We took some beautiful pictures from the top of the monument.
